description: Enterprise techniques used by FIN8, ATT&CK group G0061 v1.0
name: FIN8 (G0061)

techniques.comment: [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used environment variables and standard input (stdin) to obfuscate command-line arguments. [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) also obfuscates malicious macros delivered as payloads.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has distributed targeted emails containing Word documents with embedded malicious macros.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has tunneled RDP backdoors over port 443.

[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has utilized [Valid Accounts](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1078) during and [Persistence](https://attack.mitre.org/tactics/TA0003) and [Lateral Movement](https://attack.mitre.org/tactics/TA0008).
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used RAR to compress collected data before [Exfiltration](https://attack.mitre.org/tactics/TA0010).
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used remote code execution to download subsequent payloads.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has leveraged both Spearphishing Link and Spearphishing Attachment attempting to gain User Execution.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used a Batch file to automate frequently executed post compromise cleanup activities.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used RDP for [Lateral Movement](https://attack.mitre.org/tactics/TA0008).
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) executes commands remotely via cmd.exe.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has deleted tmp and prefetch files during post compromise cleanup activities.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has cleared logs during post compromise cleanup activities.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) harvests credentials using Invoke-Mimikatz or Windows Credentials Editor (WCE).
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used scheduled tasks to maintain RDP backdoors.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used FTP to exfiltrate collected data.

[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061)'s malicious spearphishing payloads use WMI to launch malware and spawn cmd.exe execution. [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has also used WMIC during and post compromise cleanup activities.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) uses [dsquery](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0105) and other Active Directory utilities to enumerate hosts.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used the Plink utility to tunnel RDP back to C2 infrastructure.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has attempted to map to C$ on enumerated hosts to test the scope of their current credentials/context.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has exploited the CVE-2016-0167 local vulnerability.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has deleted Registry keys during post compromise cleanup activities.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has distributed targeted emails containing links to malicious documents with embedded macros.

[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061)'s malicious spearphishing payloads are executed as [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1086). [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has also used [PowerShell](https://attack.mitre.org/techniques/T1086) during [Lateral Movement](https://attack.mitre.org/tactics/TA0008) and [Credential Access](https://attack.mitre.org/tactics/TA0006).
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) aggregates staged data from a network into a single location.
[FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061) has used Registry keys to detect and avoid executing in potential sandboxes.
